body: @wu-sheng I prefer the second one,  our product should be user friendly， the first one is not so concise. I can do this task,  By the way, in practical usage，It's better to have a frontend that can easily edit this composite rules

Support real grammar expression I think it's a very useful and cool thing. 
At the Implementation, all of the metrics don't need to rehash and send the data in the cluster mode, because metrics using the entity id and time bucket as hashcode, this rule make sure the same service, instance, endpoint at the same OAP machine. 

One more thing, should we need to add more group combiner? Such as some different dev teams using the alarm, they maybe use the different notify way or config.

> By the way, in practical usage，It's better to have a frontend that can easily edit this composite rules

That is for sure, at the same time, you have to consider to work with the dynamic configuration center. My personal suggestion is, you could consider creating a project about SkyWalking alarm center. We should discuss it on another issue.

> At the Implementation, all of the metrics don't need to rehash and send the data in the cluster mode, because metrics using the entity id and time bucket as hashcode, this rule make sure the same service, instance, endpoint at the same OAP machine.

Yes, it is. That is why I highlight the group alarm process.

> One more thing, should we need to add more group combiner? Such as some different dev teams using the alarm, they maybe use the different notify way or config.

I think that is a different concept, which clearly would be a breaking change. Let's talk on another issue if any of one prefer to consider this as a real and reasonable feature.

> > One more thing, should we need to add more group combiner? Such as some different dev teams using the alarm, they maybe use the different notify way or config.
> 
> I think that is a different concept, which clearly would be a breaking change. Let's talk on another issue if any of one prefer to consider this as a real and reasonable feature.

Sure. The group concept in the alarm core it's very useful, sounds goods to me.

The L167 is like this.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/oal-rt/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oal/rt/OALRuntime.java#L167

What is the issue?
agent supports env as instance ，such as MY_POD_NAME

Could you share a demo code with memory leak?
Unfortunately I can not share the code as this is a commercial application. Also difficult to provide a demo code as the application is quite complex order management system.
What could you provide to give us some tips? OOM is not a thing easy to locate.

You need a context to include these two operations. Try to add `@Trace` or use `custom-enhance-plugin` to track the method including these two. 
We also have highlighted the solution for Kafka consumer case, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/FAQ/kafka-plugin.md.

I observed the JVM in VisualVM and I see high activity of vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 allocating ~75% memory. When skywalking agent not enabled it is on ~35%. It takes ~12h for the app to exhaust memory (heap size is 512m).

In the agent log these are the interesting logs appearing:
WARN 2020-09-14 09:37:39:972 vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 TracingContext : More than 300 spans required to create

Also I was unable to disable Vert.x plugin activation using -Dskywalking.plugin.exclude_plugins="vertx-core-3.x".

@wu-sheng, not really. I can't tell where the NPE or IOOBE is coming from without the full stack trace.
